definitions.definition: To connect or combine into one; to put together.
definitions.example: The plumber joined the two ends of the broken pipe.

definitions.definition: To come into the company of.
definitions.example: I will join you watching the football game as soon as I have finished my work.
Many children join a sports club.

definitions.definition: To produce an intersection of data in two or more database tables.
definitions.example: By joining the Customer table on the Product table, we can show each customer's name alongside the products they have ordered.

definitions.definition: To accept, or engage in, as a contest.
definitions.example: to join encounter, battle, or issue

definitions.definition: The act or result of joining; a joint or juncture.
